api_token.description: API token used to authenticate with the Instana Backend

default_name_prefix.description: The default prefix which should be added to all resource names/labels

default_name_suffix.description: The default suffix which should be added to all resource names/labels - default '(TF managed)'

endpoint.description: The DNS Name of the Instana Endpoint (eg. saas-eu-west-1.instana.io)

emails.description: The list of emails of the Email alerting channel

full_name.description: The the full name field of the alerting channel. The field is computed and contains the name which is sent to instana. The computation depends on the configured default_name_prefix and default_name_suffix at provider level

name.description: Configures the name of the alerting channel

http_headers.description: The optional map of HTTP headers of the Webhook alerting channel

name.description: Configures the name of the alerting channel

webhook_urls.description: The list of webhook urls of the Webhook alerting channel

alert_name.description: Configures the alert name of the alerting configuration

event_filter_event_types.description: Configures the list of Event Types IDs which should trigger an alert.

event_filter_query.description: Configures a filter query to to filter rules or event types for a limited set of entities

event_filter_rule_ids.description: Configures the list of Rule IDs which should trigger an alert.

full_alert_name.description: The the full alert name field of the alerting configuration. The field is computed and contains the name which is sent to instana. The computation depends on the configured default_name_prefix and default_name_suffix at provider level

integration_ids.description: Configures the list of Integration IDs (Alerting Channels).

access_granting_token.description: The token used for the api Client used in the Authorization header to authenticate the client

can_configure_agent_run_mode.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure agent run mode

can_configure_agents.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure agents

can_configure_api_tokens.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure API tokens

can_configure_applications.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure applications

can_configure_authentication_methods.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure authentication methods

can_configure_custom_alerts.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure custom alerts

can_configure_global_alert_configs.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure global alert configs

can_configure_global_alert_payload.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure global alert payload

can_configure_integrations.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure integrations

can_configure_log_management.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure log management

can_configure_mobile_app_monitoring.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure Mobile App Monitoring

can_configure_releases.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure releases

can_configure_users.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to configure users

can_view_account_and_billing_information.description: Configures if the API token is allowed to view account and billing information

full_name.description: The full name of the API token including prefix in suffix

internal_id.description: The internal ID of the access token from the Instana platform

name.description: The name of the API token

boundary_scope.description: The boundary scope of the application config

full_label.description: The the full label field of the application config. The field is computed and contains the label which is sent to instana. The computation depends on the configured default_name_prefix and default_name_suffix at provider level

label.description: The label of the application config

match_specification.description: The match specification of the application config

scope.description: The scope of the application config

tag_filter.description: The tag filter of the application config

description.description: Configures the description text of the custom event specification

enabled.description: Configures if the custom event specification is enabled or not

entity_type.description: The computed entity type of a entity verification rule 'host'

expiration_time.description: Configures the expiration time (grace period) to wait before the issue is closed

name.description: Configures the name of the custom event specification

query.description: Configures the dynamic focus query for the custom event specification

rule_matching_entity_label.description: The label of the matching entity

rule_matching_entity_type.description: The type of the matching entity

rule_matching_operator.description: The operator which should be applied for matching the label for the given entity (e.g. IS, CONTAINS, STARTS_WITH, ENDS_WITH, NONE)

rule_offline_duration.description: The duration after which the matching entity is considered to be offline

rule_severity.description: Configures the severity of the rule of the custom event specification

triggering.description: Configures the custom event specification should trigger an incident

enabled.description: Configures if the custom event specification is enabled or not

entity_type.description: The computed entity type of a entity verification rule 'any'

expiration_time.description: Configures the expiration time (grace period) to wait before the issue is closed

query.description: Configures the dynamic focus query for the custom event specification

rule_severity.description: Configures the severity of the rule of the custom event specification

rule_system_rule_id.description: Configures the system rule id for the system rule of the custom event specification

triggering.description: Configures the custom event specification should trigger an incident

description.description: Configures the description text of the custom event specification

enabled.description: Configures if the custom event specification is enabled or not

expiration_time.description: Configures the expiration time (grace period) to wait before the issue is closed

full_name.description: The computed full name of the custom event specification. The field contains the name which is sent to instana. The computation depends on the configured default_name_prefix and default_name_suffix at provider level

name.description: Configures the name of the custom event specification

query.description: Configures the dynamic focus query for the custom event specification

rule_condition_value.description: The expected condition value to fulfill the rule

rule_metric_name.description: The metric name of the rule

rule_metric_pattern_placeholder.description: The metric pattern placeholer/condition value of a dynamic built-in metrics

rule_metric_pattern_postfix.description: The metric pattern postfix of a dynamic built-in metrics

rule_metric_pattern_prefix.description: The metric pattern prefix of a dynamic built-in metrics

rule_severity.description: Configures the severity of the rule of the custom event specification

rule_window.description: The time window where the condition has to be fulfilled

triggering.description: Configures the custom event specification should trigger an incident

full_name.description: The full name of the group. The field is computed and contains the name which is sent to instana. The computation depends on the configured default_name_prefix and default_name_suffix at provider level

email.description: The email address of the group member

user_id.description: The user id of the group member

application_ids.description: The scope bindings to restrict access to applications

infra_dfq_filter.description: The scope binding for the dynamic filter query to restrict access to infrastructure assets

kubernetes_cluster_uuids.description: The scope bindings to restrict access to Kubernetes Clusters

kubernetes_namespaces_uuids.description: The scope bindings to restrict access to Kubernetes namespaces

mobile_app_ids.description: The scope bindings to restrict access to mobile apps

permissions.description: The permissions assigned which should be assigned to the users of the group

website_ids.description: The scope bindings to restrict access to websites

block.description: The permission set of the group

full_name.description: The full name of the SLI config. The field is computed and contains the name which is sent to instana. The computation depends on the configured default_name_prefix and default_name_suffix at provider level

initial_evaluation_timestamp.description: Initial evaluation timestamp for the SLI config

name.description: The name of the SLI config

aggregation.description: The aggregation type for the metric configuration (SUM, MEAN, MAX, MIN, P25, P50, P75, P90, P95, P98, P99, DISTINCT_COUNT)

metric_name.description: The metric name for the metric configuration

threshold.description: The threshold for the metric configuration

block.description: Metric configuration for the SLI config

boundary_scope.description: The boundary scope for the entity configuration (ALL, INBOUND)

endpoint_id.description: The endpoint ID of the entity

service_id.description: The service ID of the entity

block.description: The entity to use for the SLI config

app_name.description: Configures the calculated app name of the website monitoring configuration

name.description: Configures the name of the website monitoring configuration

description.description: The description text of the builtin event.

enabled.description: Indicates if the builtin event is enabled or not

name.description: The name of the builtin event

severity.description: The severity (WARNING, CRITICAL, etc.) of the builtin event.

severity_code.description: The severity code used by Instana API (5, 10, etc.) of the builtin event.

short_plugin_id.description: The plugin id for which the builtin event is created.

triggering.description: Indicates if an incident is triggered the builtin event or not.
